page.title: 09 AYNHO:INTERESTING BUILDINGS
page.content: The {ALMSHOUSES} were built in 1822 for old people. There are 8 terraced houses built of stone with a slate roof. There is an arch in the middle and 4 houses on each side. John Baker, an Oxford glazier built them for old people from Aynho or St. Aldates, Oxford. The {GRAMMAR HOUSE} used to be a school from 1695 for 200yrs and then it became the Cartwright's Dower House. There are 3 cellars, one of which is thought to have a secret passage. There is a balcony near the roof. The windows are stone-mullioned. The {STOCKS} are in Roundtown and were used when people had to be punished. They are 2 horizontal planks of wood with holes which the person's legs were put through. They were left there for a day and pelted with rotten eggs etc.
